senses.sense_definition: To remove the testicles of a male; to castrate.

examples.text: In ancient history, rulers would sometimes <w>evirate</w> servants to ensure their loyalty.
The veterinarian had to <w>evirate</w> the aggressive animal to make it safer to handle.

senses.sense_definition: To deprive of manly qualities or vigor; to weaken.

examples.text: Constant criticism can <w>evirate</w> a person's confidence and drive.
The oppressive laws served to <w>evirate</w> the spirit of the rebellion.
